alert.note: Alert for Northern Worcester; Southern Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 1:18PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Worcester County through 215 PM EDT... At 117 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Charlton, or 11 miles southwest of Worcester, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Worcester, Shrewsbury, Holden, Auburn, Northborough, Oxford, Charlton, Spencer, Leicester, Sturbridge, Rutland, Sterling, West Boylston, Barre, Warren, Paxton, North Brookfield, Hubbardston, Boylston and West Brookfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. This storm may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.
